III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
Cedar Creek Teaching Family Home, 1015 Silver Creek Rd., Marquette, MI 49855 is a
new facility built as a residential treatment center. The construction was completed in
May 2006.
The facility has two levels, which are each approximately 2,600 square feet each.
The lower level has a recreation room (574.29 square feet) and an approximately 1200
square foot live-in couple two bedroom, full bath apartment. There are two stairways in
the lower level, one to the center of the facility and the other on the northeast corner for
the apartment. There is also a half bath, a storage room, and a furnace room in the
lower level.
The facility has six bedrooms as follows:
Bedroom 1 (located at the southwest corner) is 156 square feet.
Bedroom 2 located at the northwest corner) is 89.75 square feet.
Bedroom 3 (located toward the center next to Bedroom 2) is 89.38 square feet.
Bedroom 4 (located toward the center next to Bedroom 5) is 89.79 square feet.
Bedroom 5 (located at the northeast corner) is 90.62 square feet.
Bedroom 6( located at the southeast corner) is 169.46 square feet.
Bedroom 1 and 6 have two closets. Three bedrooms are on the west wing and 3
bedrooms are on the east wing. Each wing has a full bath, which is approximately 65
square feet. There is a laundry room, which is 79.09 square feet.
Living, dining, and kitchen area are open and in the center of the building, totaling
702.64 square feet. There is a deck on the back of the facility. There is an office and
family room/TV room (168.83 square feet) near the front door.
B. Program Description
2

Teaching Family Homes of Upper Michigan currently has five Child Caring Institution
active licenses. The plan is to close CI520201029 also called Cedar Creek Teaching
Family Home when the new Cedar Creek Teaching Family Home is licensed. The
proposed facility will be an eight bed open residential treatment facility (which is an
increase from the six bed CI520201029). The program is based on cognitive/behavioral
principles and the Girls and Boys Town Psycho Educational Model.
The new Cedar Creek Teaching Family Home’s school program will use the Marquette
Public Schools.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The facility has established compliance with all rules that can be measured before
approval of a new license, and has established intent to comply with all rules that can
only be measured after the approval of a provisional license. “A” ratings with no
noncompliances are documented in the Fire Safety Inspection Report received on
05/17/2006 and the Environmental Health Inspection Report completed on 05/22/2006.
Zoning Approval was received by licensing on 05/03/2006 in a letter-dated December
20, 2005 from the Zoning Administrator of Sands Township.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend issuance of an original provisional six-month license, Child Caring
Institution, Private.
